item.title: Encryption, Biometrics, and the Status Quo Ante
item.description: Authors: Rosenzweig, Paul Published: July 2015 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/encryption-biometrics-and-status-quo-ante Abstract: On July 6, 2015, Paul Rosenzweig, founder of Red Branch Consulting PLLC, wrote about a paradigm shift in the encryption debate, and offered a solution to deal with the paradigm shift. In 1995, data “could not be maintained in an undecryptable format”, access to data was “achieved through lawful process (either a search warrant or a subpoena)”, and the subject of an investigation received notice.

item.title: New Perspectives on the Future of Encryption
item.description: Authors: Baker, Jim and Landau, Susan Published: May 2019 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/new-perspectives-future-encryption Abstract: Encryption and its effects on law enforcement’s access to data seem to occupy a perennial place in the headlines (and on Lawfare as well). The two of us have been working on it for years. The subject is often highly contested, but the fierce discussion has ignored some critical factors. One of those is how changing usage patterns and technologies will affect how law enforcement can—or can’t—obtain access.
